ROW.Name_Event: Paduan doctors meet the Doge in the Sala del Maggior Consiglio for discussing about plague
Foundation of the church and convent
ROW.Synopsis: The Basso family sponsored the construction of a small church and convent to be entrusted to a group of Benedictine nuns. The island is dedicated to San Secondo and Sant'Erasmo.

ROW.Name_Event: Doge Falier's donation to the Benedectine nuns of a saltworks
ROW.Synopsis: The Doge Vitale Falier donates a fundamentum or saltworks located in the sestiere of Santa Croce (once called Luprio). The church is described in bad condition.

ROW.Name_Event: Donations to the Benedectine nuns
ROW.Synopsis: The Benedictine nuns were donated some fields in the Trevigiano area because of the poor economic conditions of their convent.

ROW.Name_Event: Settlement of Augustinian Canons in Santo Spirito
First documentation regarding the relics of San Secondo in the island
ROW.Synopsis: Gerardino da Villanova sells some lands in the Trevigiano area to the abbess. He also donates two iugeri (plots of land) located near Treviso. In exchange, he askes that the proceeds are used to buy the oil for illuminating the altar of San Secondo.

ROW.Name_Event: Foundation of the church and a pilgrims' hostel
ROW.Synopsis: According to the chronicle by Enrico Dandolo, the wealthy merchant Pietro Gattilesso put up money to build a church and a pilgrim's hospital dedicated to St Clement Pope on the island that would henceforth bear his name. Both the church and hospital were put under the jurisdiction of the Patriarch of Grado, Enrico Dandolo.

ROW.Name_Event: Blessing of the new religious complex
ROW.Synopsis: The Patriarch places and blesses the first stone of the complex.

ROW.Name_Event: The island is organized with new buildings
ROW.Synopsis: According to Father Davide da Portogruaro, the church and hospital were actually founded in 1146. For sure, at this time the island is inhabitated by the Canons regular of St Augustine.

ROW.Name_Event: The Bishop of Castello, Giovanni Polani, recognizes the Patriarch of Grado's jurisdiction on the island
ROW.Synopsis: The Bishop writes a long declaration in which he accepts the jurisdiction of the Patriarch Enrico Dandolo on the church and hospital of San Clemente. However, he still is en charged of the administration of the hospital's income.

ROW.Name_Event: Alberico Lottario, Bishop of Rimini, donates to the canons the church of San Giacomo in Rimini, alongside its properties
ROW.Synopsis: Every year, the church of San Giacomo must donate a pound (libbra) of pepper, a pound of incense, and, on the fest of the saint, half of the lamn donated to the church.

ROW.Name_Event: Imizza e Daniele from Selva di Boggion donate a portion of land in Pellestrina to the Canons Regular
The Litaldo family donates some lands in Pellestrina to the Canons Regular
The Canons regular of San Clemente are confirmed under the jurisdiction of the Patriarch of Grado
ROW.Synopsis: The decision was made in the church of San Clemente.

ROW.Name_Event: The inscription in commemoration of the Doge Polani celebrates the foundation of the island under his rule
ROW.Synopsis: After the death of Pietro Polani, the following inscription was depicted around his effigy: «Fanum sub me tributarium effecitur Monasteria Sanctorum Clementis et Iacobi de Palude construuntur»

ROW.Name_Event: Angelo Rosso donates a land in Malamocco to the Canons Regular
ROW.Synopsis: Alongside Rosso's donation, other lands in Piove di Sacco, Fossò, Bogion were given to the Canons.

ROW.Name_Event: The relics of Sant'Aniano are brought to the church of San Clemente from Alexandria
Construction of a new apartment for the Patriarch Egidio da Ferrara
ROW.Synopsis: The Dominican Patriarch asks the Canons to build an apartment for him in the island. This is built on the southern-est corner of the island, in front of the vegetable garden and "near the old building". It consists of many rooms, a living room equipped with a fireplace and a small loggia (lobiolam). The rooms are remembered as small but cozy (prelibatae) in a document dated 1643. In this description, one room is mentioned as "la camera d'oro" because it was decorated with gilded carvings.

ROW.Name_Event: The Patriarch Egidio da Ferrara donates his apartment within the island to the Canons Regular
The vacant priory of San Clemente is administrated by the Canons of Santo Spirito
ROW.Synopsis: After the death of the prior Nicolò de Arimundo, Pope John XXII gives the vacant priory to the Canon Regular Nicolò de Benvenuti who lived in Santo Spirito. The decision sheds light on the decline of the decline of the island's fortune.

ROW.Name_Event: Pope Boniface IX chooses the church as a place for new indulgences
ROW.Synopsis: This initiative was meant to increase the influx of pilgrims.

ROW.Name_Event: The island is administered by the Papacy
ROW.Synopsis: In 1357, the Pope elected Franchino da Bologna as new prior.

ROW.Name_Event: Election of Andrea Bondumier as Prior
Settlement of the eremitani from Santa Giustina in Padua
The canons adopt the Augustinian rule
Move of the Cistercian order from Brondolo
ROW.Synopsis: The Venetian Senate entrusts the island to the Cistercian friars of the Santissima Trinità di Brondolo whose institute did not raise up after the Genoese War (1379-81).

ROW.Name_Event: The island passes to the Lateran Canons of Santa Maria della Carità
ROW.Synopsis: Pope Eugene IV joins the monastery of San Clemente to that of Santa Maria della Carità.

ROW.Name_Event: Foundation of the Provveditori alla Sanità (Health Office)
Plague spreads in Venice
The Office of the Provveditori alla Sanità is made permanent
Gabriele Coldulmer is elected Pope
The Lateran Canons set up in the island while all the properties of San Clemente, including archival documents and relics, are transferred to Santa Maria della Carità
ROW.Synopsis: The relics of Sant'Aniano are brought to the church of Santa Maria della Carità and install on the main altar in 1453.

ROW.Name_Event: Antonio de Lusciano from Milan is the new prior of the island
ROW.Synopsis: The prior Pietro Maffei, along with other Lateran Canons and friars from San Giorgio Maggiore, elected the new prior of San Clemente. Other canons are transferred to the island that begins to be inhabited regularly.

ROW.Name_Event: Significant renovation works to the romanic church
ROW.Synopsis: The works focused on the main facade. Father Davide Maria da Portogruaro attributed the works to the Lombardo family.

ROW.Name_Event: The monastery is enlarged and enriched with a new cloister
ROW.Synopsis: The monastery is enlarged to house 17 new canons. A new cloister on two levels with arcades and marble columns is built.

ROW.Name_Event: Doge Agostino Barbarigo and Senate donate an old galea to the Canons whose timber could be used for renovating their monastery
The Emperor Frederick III is received by the Doge Francesco Foscari in San Clemente
ROW.Synopsis:
Coming from Rome, the Emperor along with many princes stop in Venice.
«fu dal Consiglio dei X terminato che il Dose le dovesse andar incontro col Bucintoro a S. Clemente. Giunto l'imperatore a Chiozza [...] trovò la nobiltà, che l'attendeva, et vene seco a S. Clemente dove era il Dose con il Bucintoro coperto di panno d'oro e sei piatte piene di nobili Veneti: ogni arte di Venetia ornò il suo palischermo et altre gentilezze e furono caricate tre galie di questi artigiani; et furono tra le galie et palischermi et barche a modo di Ganzare, più di 120 et di più le barche delle contrade con gli suoi peate et altre barche di Venetia, che pareva un'armata. Giunto a S. Clemente l'imperatore montò in Bucintoro e si pose nella sedia del Dose et vennero nel canal Grande».

ROW.Name_Event: The Emperor Frederick III is again received by the Doge in San Clemente
The Emperor Frederick III is hosted in Santo Spirito the night before the meeting with the Doge
The Doge Foscari meets the Emperor John VIII Palaiologos in the island
ROW.Synopsis: The Doge reaches the island with the Bucintoro and then, together with the Emperor, they move to the island of San Giorgio Maggiore.

ROW.Name_Event: The Emperor John VIII Palaiologos is housed in the island's guestroom
The Dogaressa Foscari meets the Queen of Cyprus in the island
ROW.Synopsis: From Sanudo: «Qui zonse ozi la Regina di Cipri, fiola del Marchese di Monferà. Li fo fatto honor assai; li andò contra la Dogaressa con una quantittà di donne per numero 124 (fra le qual ne errano di vestide di panno d’orro et brochatto numero 53, di seda circha 40, il resto con manto et con veste morelle) nel bucintoro, il qual andò fino a San Chimento. Fo armado parasc[h]ermi 8, barche in grandissima quantittà. Arivò a cha’ di sier Zuan Corner dalla Piscopia, la vene qui con una nave del Ducha di Millan coverta di piombo, molto serada, et haveva da persone 300 con sí, in reliquis la Dogaressa per stracheza per do volte stramortì et fo portà in Pallazo con una barcha, et si compì la festa avanti hore 23.»

ROW.Name_Event: The Duke Ercole I is received by the Doge Barbarigo in the island
Beginning of the restoration of the Dominican monastery
ROW.Synopsis: After the arrival of the Dominican friars of San Domenico di Castello, the monastery is restored. Giovanni da Zon, the architect and proto dei muratori all'Arsenale presents his design along with a wooden model.

ROW.Name_Event: The island is used as lazzaretto
ROW.Synopsis: The Dominican friars are removed and transferred to the monastery of San Domenico di Castello. The island is transformed into a lazzaretto for people infected with plague. The friars' goods are moved to the library and the chapel of the Cross or to the church of San Giobbe in Venice.

ROW.Name_Event: Introduction of the Observant reform into the Benedictine convent
ROW.Synopsis: Patriarch Antonio Contarini sends the abbess Marina Celsi along with 21 nuns because she introduces the Observant reform into the convent. The convent is divided into two parts, one for the observant nuns, the other for the conventual nuns.

ROW.Name_Event: Suppression of the Benedictine community
ROW.Synopsis: Clemente VII suppresses the religious community and transfers the Benedictine nuns to the Giudecca. The abbatial title of the church is estinguished.

ROW.Name_Event: Relocation of the Dominican friars coming from Tuscany
ROW.Synopsis: A group of Dominican friars coming from Tuscany arrives to the island under the guidance of Fra Zaccaria da Luni who is appointed as Vicario generale.

ROW.Name_Event: Delivering of the altarpiece Discesa dello Spirito Santo
ROW.Synopsis: Titian delivers the first version of the altarpiece Discesa dello Spirito Santo for the main chapel of the church.

ROW.Name_Event: Agostino Museo is attested in the monastery
ROW.Synopsis: The hermit preacher Agostino Museo teaches sacred writings and philosophy within the monastery.

ROW.Name_Event: Consecration of two altars
Sansovino is attested working in the church
ROW.Synopsis: An Augustinian monk refers of the presence of Jacopo Sansovino in the church. In the same year, Tuitian was completing the Pentecost painting that was already installed on the main altar of the church.

ROW.Name_Event: Titian is appointed for painting the altarpiece of the Pentecost
Installation of the Pentecost painting by Titian
Completion of the church's restoration
Consecration of four altars
ROW.Synopsis: Consecration of the last four altars of the church.

ROW.Name_Event: The Benedictine nuns move to the Giudecca bringing the relics of the saint
ROW.Synopsis: The nuns move to the convent of Santi Cosma e Damiano and bring with them the body of San Secondo.

ROW.Name_Event: Relocation of the preaching friars of San Domenico di Castello
ROW.Synopsis: The monastery of San Secondo is annexed to the Provincia di Lombardia. Fra Angelo Bragadin, prior of San Domenico di Castello, relocates his community in the insland.

ROW.Name_Event: A fire destroys the roof of the church
ROW.Synopsis: The fire destroys the roof of the church and some beams collapse on the altar of San Secondo. The altarpiece by Giovanni Buonconsiglio doesn't get damaged.

ROW.Name_Event: Construction of a powderhouse
ROW.Synopsis: After the fire in the Arsenal, the Senate decides to locate some powderhouses on the islands of the lagoon. The first one to be built is in San Secondo.

ROW.Name_Event: The Dominican Friars return to the island
ROW.Synopsis: Following the restoration of the several island's places (buildings, gardens, and orchards) damaged during the plague, the Friars take again possession of their monastery.

ROW.Name_Event: Restoration of the chapel of San Secondo
ROW.Synopsis: The chapel and the coffer with the relics of San Secondo are restored thanks to the financial support of the Patriarch Giovanni Trevisan, the Bishop of Vicenza Matteo Priuli, and the nuns of the Corpus Domini. The chest is made in carved and gold-plated marble, while a crystal glass protected the front of the coffer.

ROW.Name_Event: Decoration of the church and construction of the right chapel
ROW.Synopsis: Construction of a new chapel on the right of the main chapel.

ROW.Name_Event: The procurator Filippo Tron asks for a burial in the choir of the church
Beginnig of the church's restoration
A thunder strikes the bell tower
ROW.Synopsis: A bolt of lightning strikes the bell tower. This is restored thanks to the financial support of Pietro Bon.

ROW.Name_Event: The Camaldolese monks move temporarily to the island
ROW.Synopsis: The Camaldolese monks of San Michele di Murano arrived in San Secondo but the Council of Ten forces the nuns to come back to their original island.

ROW.Name_Event: Titian accuses the Lateran Canons of not paying his work
ROW.Synopsis: Titian writes to Cardinal Alessandro Farnese accusing the Lateran Canons of not paying his canvases for the ceiling in Santo Spirito.

ROW.Name_Event: Construction of a new dormitory
The Office of the Provveditori alla Sanità is given criminal power on health laws
Marin Sanudo testifies the presence of the predictor Pietro Nani in the island
ROW.Synopsis: Marin Sanudo says that many patricians used to go visiting the old friar in the island: «30 maggio noto: a S. Chimento era un certo frate di l'ordine di la Charità, qual è gran tempo sta lì con un converso [...] et dice molte cosse, qual le traze di prophetie. Et io fui da lui ozi; mi disse molte cosse. Ha gran corso di patricii

ROW.Name_Event: The Cardinal Schinner is received by the Doge Loredan in the island
The Cardinal Giles of Viterbo is received by the Doge Loredan in the island
ROW.Synopsis: The Cardinal asks to spend the entire day in the island.

ROW.Name_Event: The Duke Francesco II Sforza is received by the Doge Gritti in the island
ROW.Synopsis: The Doge meets him in the church.

ROW.Name_Event: The Duke of Urbin, Francesco Maria I della Rovere, is received by Venetian noblemen in the island
ROW.Synopsis: Coming from Chioggia, he stops in San Clemente but he is not received by the Doge.

ROW.Name_Event: Saint Cajetan along with 13 clerics resides in San Clemente
ROW.Synopsis: Among the 13 clerics there is also the future Pope Paul IV, Gian Pietro Carafa.

ROW.Name_Event: The island is used as lazzaretto for some patricians coming from Lesina d'Istria
ROW.Synopsis: The Lateran Canons decide to house some patricians coming from Lesina d'Istria (a place that was infected with plague) through their own boat (brigantino) that was later sunk.

ROW.Name_Event: The island is used as lazzaretto for captain Alessandro Pesaro and some other infected colleagues
ROW.Synopsis: The Provveditori alla Sanità led only the captain and some other patroni being housed in San Clemente. The rest of the fleet is sent to the Lazzaretto Nuovo for the quarantine.

ROW.Name_Event: The island is used as lazzaretto for the captain and knight Sebastiano Giustinian who was coming back from Candia
The island is used as lazzaretto for the Tuscan ambassador Bartolomeo Gualtierotti
ROW.Synopsis: He was asked to stay in the island for a few days.

ROW.Name_Event: Introduction of the Dominican reform into the monastery
ROW.Synopsis: The monastery is affiliated to the Congregazione dell'osservanza del Beato Jacopo Salomoni.

ROW.Name_Event: Reconstruction of the church
ROW.Synopsis: The church is completely reconstructed along with two cells located near the sacristy.

ROW.Name_Event: Restoration of the public shelter for boats
ROW.Synopsis: The Senate imposes the reconstruction of the public cavana located in the island.

ROW.Name_Event: Institution of a collegio for the chierici dell'Osservanza
ROW.Synopsis: The collegio existed only until 1689.

ROW.Name_Event: Restoration of the church's interior
ROW.Synopsis: The interior of the church is completely demolished. A new choir and a pendentive dome are constructed by the murer Angelo Garavan under the supervision of the architect Baldassare Longhena.

ROW.Name_Event: Suppression of the Lateran Canons
ROW.Synopsis: With the papal bill In vineam Domini the Pope Alessandro VII suppressed 75 convents in Venice (later reduced to 59). Among them there were the Lateran Canons of Santo Spirito.

ROW.Name_Event: Survey of the entire island
ROW.Synopsis: The survey includes an inventory and the description of the church of Santo Spirito.

ROW.Name_Event: Establishment of an inventory of the church
ROW.Synopsis: Baldassare Longhena is asked to prepare an inventory and a description of the church of Santo Spirito.

ROW.Name_Event: Reconstruction of the loggia
ROW.Synopsis: The loggia facing the garden of the friars is reconstructed following the design provided by friar Alessandro Malerba.

ROW.Name_Event: Consecration of the new church
ROW.Synopsis: After the massive restoration campaign started in 1563, the new church of San Secondo is consecrated.

ROW.Name_Event: The French ambassador finds refuge in the monastery for escaping the plague
ROW.Synopsis: The French ambassador leaves his palace in Venice to go to the island of San Secondo in oder to escape the plague.

ROW.Name_Event: Restoration of many buildings within the monastery
ROW.Synopsis: The restoration regards almost all the buildings of the monastery. Works will continue until 1751.

ROW.Name_Event: The Candian Friars move to the island
ROW.Synopsis: The Candian Friars re-found their convent, which then endured until it was suppressed by Napoleon in 1806.

ROW.Name_Event: The Titian's paintings of the ceiling are moved to Santa Maria della Salute
ROW.Synopsis: The cycle of old testament paintings that Titian painted for the ceiling of Santo Spirito (1541-1544) are moved to the sacristy of the church of Santa Maria della Salute.

ROW.Name_Event: The teacher and his four novices are removed from the island
Survey of the entire island
ROW.Synopsis: Asked by the Procurators of St. Mark, Baldassare Longhena surveys the vegetable gardens, convent, cloisters, refectories, walls, and infrastructure existing in the island of Santo Spirito (apart from the church, bell tower, and the other sacred places). He estimates the cost of these places up to 13,000 ducats.

ROW.Name_Event: Project for a new private shelter for boats
ROW.Synopsis: The drawing is part of a set of documents related to the catastico made by padre Daniele Danieli in 1694.

ROW.Name_Event: Father Daniele Danieli draws up a Catastico of the monastery
ROW.Synopsis: The catastico contains the survey of the church, its main portal, and the loggia.

ROW.Name_Event: The ambassador Alessandro de Strigis and his entourage are send to the Lazzaretto Vecchio
ROW.Synopsis: The Marquis was sent by the Duke Carlo Gonzaga to Wien for signing the peace with the Emperor Ferdinand II. Because he comes from an infected city he is quarantined the lazzaretto.

ROW.Name_Event: The ambassador Alessandro de Strigis and part of his entourage are transferred to the island of San Clemente
ROW.Synopsis: Because in the Lazzaretto Vecchio there was a few cases of plague, the ambassandor is transferred to the more secure island of San Clemente. However, he already had plague and infected the carpenter Giovanni Tirinello who was working on the renovation of some buildings.

ROW.Name_Event: The ambassador Alessandro de Strigis dies of plague along with all the people who served under him
The plague spreads in the whole city
The island is used as a lazzaretto
ROW.Synopsis: Wooden shackes are arranged to admit infected people.

ROW.Name_Event: According to descriptions, the island is in a state of disrepair and the Lateran Canons cannot live in there
The Lateran Canons accept the proposal of Monsignor Lazzaroni to build a model of the Holy House of Loreto
ROW.Synopsis: To fulfil a vow made during the plague epidemic in 1630, Monsignor Lazzaroni built an image of the Virgin on cedar wood. He exposed it in his church of Sant'Angelo while waiting for building a new chapel, modelled on the Holy House of Loreto. After several attempts to locate the Holy House in the churches of Sant'Angelo, San Lazzaro, and Tolentini, he was finally granted the space in the church of San Clemente.

ROW.Name_Event: Beginning of the construction of the Holy House of Loreto
ROW.Synopsis: The prior of Santa Maria della Carità puts the first stone of the Holy House. The stone came from the church of San Silvestro and was esplicily donated by the Patriarch. The drawing and model of the House was approved by both the Prior and the Chapter.

ROW.Name_Event: The image of the Virgin is pompously translated from the church of Santa Maria della Carità to the Holy House of Loreto in San Clemente
The island is sold to the Camaldolese monks of Monte Rua
Francesco Lazzaroni together with other Venetians noblemen mediates between the Lateran Canons of Carità and the Camaldolese monks of Monte Rua for the island's sale
Construction of the new wing for the refectory
ROW.Synopsis: The work for the new refectory located in the eastern side of the island will last until the 1738.

ROW.Name_Event: Freezing of the lagoon waters
Construction of a second private shelter for boats
Design of a second private shelter for boats
The Dominican Friars are exempt from the tansa degli ortolani
ROW.Synopsis: The Dominican friars are exempt by the Collegio della Milizia da Mar from the payment of the tansa degli ortolani. They claimed the high costs of the maintenance of the public guest house located in the island.

ROW.Name_Event: The gunpowder preserved in the powderhouse is removed
ROW.Synopsis: After the petition presented by the Dominican Friars to the Senate, the gunpowder in the torresin da polvere is replaced by sulphur.

ROW.Name_Event: Two bolts of lightning strike the island
ROW.Synopsis: Two bolts of lightning strike the bell tower, the sacristy, and the church. That day the Doge Carlo Ruzzini was guest in the public cavana within the island.

ROW.Name_Event: Reconstruction of the dock
Partial ruin of the dock
ROW.Synopsis: The dock repaired in 1732 is partially ruined because of the wind and high tide.

ROW.Name_Event: Establishment of the Scuola di San Diego within the church
ROW.Synopsis: The Procuratia de Supra accepts the petition presented by the Secretary of the monastery on behalf of some devotees of San Diego who wanted to establish a Scuola (a secular confraternity) devoted to the saint. This was formerly located in the church of Poveglia.

ROW.Name_Event: Restoration of the external wall
Suppression of the Dominican community
ROW.Synopsis: The Napoleonic decree suppresses the Dominican community. The island becomes a state property.

ROW.Name_Event: Veneto is annexed to Italy
Reshape of the island into an octagon
Decision to establish the first female mental institution in Europe
ROW.Synopsis: At the suggestion of Consigliere di Luogotenenza, the Count Muzzani, the Austrian Empire decided to establish a female mental institution.

ROW.Name_Event: Public contract between the Fondo territoriale and the company Alverà Varetton
ROW.Synopsis: The Fondo territoriale was the owner of the island.

ROW.Name_Event: Demolition of the monastery and small houses for noblemen
ROW.Synopsis: The island is raised to the ground and the entire monastery, alongside the houses for noblemen, is demolished. The church is spared but all its artworks are removed.

ROW.Name_Event: All the artworks belonging to the church are transferred to the Accademia
ROW.Synopsis: (Verbale n. 3811). The paintings will later transferred to the Ducal Palace.

ROW.Name_Event: Beginning of the works for the construction of the mental institution
End of the works for the construction of the mental institution
ROW.Synopsis: The whole project costed 3 million lire.

ROW.Name_Event: Opening of the new female mental institution
Island's elargement
ROW.Synopsis: The island is expanded through land reclamation. A new garden and vegetable garden are added.

ROW.Name_Event: The island is definitively abandoned
ROW.Synopsis: After the II World War the island is used by private citizens and then abandoned.

ROW.Name_Event: The island is demilitarized
ROW.Synopsis: Following the end of the II World War, the island is demilitarized.

ROW.Name_Event: The island is definitively abandoned
Photographic campaign on the church
Photographic campaign on the church
The island becomes property of the Venetian Municipality
Hospitalized patients are dismissed
The Soprintendenza per i Beni artistici e storici di Venezia orders to trasfer artworks to another location
Artworks are transferred to the Galleria Franchetti (Ca' d'Oro), to the restoration laboratory in San Gregorio, and to the venues of the Venetian U.S.L.
The women mental hospital is closed
ROW.Synopsis: The formal dismission is issued by the Unità Sanitaria Locale (deliberation n. 1099).

ROW.Name_Event: The island is abandoned
The island is robbed of many artworks (paintings, busts, altars)
The wooden choir of the sacristy is transferred to the sacristy of Ognissanti
The island is no more used for sanitary purposes
ROW.Synopsis: The Giunta Regionale declares that the island's use is no more sanitary (prot. n. 5435).

ROW.Name_Event: The association Italia Nostra ispects the island
The association Italia Nostra ispects the island
